results.title: The Heart: how it works
results.brief_description: Shows the structure of the heart, and how it serves as a pump for the circulation of blood. Explains methods for testing and examining, showing the stethoscope, and analyses the sound cycles by which this instrument works. Concludes with some startling facts about the ordinary workload of the heart.

results.title: The Heart of England
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: The heart of England lies in the Cotswold country. The changes in the seasons bring to this area are seen first in early spring, with the harrowing of the rich fields, the first buds on the trees, the blossoming orchards. Later comes the Three Counties Show at Hereford, cricket at Cheltenham on the village green, and finally the harvest and the traditional fairs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Clarke, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films

results.title: The Heart of a nation
results.brief_description: A film record of the 1953 Welsh Eisteddford featuring the ceremonial and some of the typical international song and dance events that take place at this famous annual festival. In this instance the festival was held at Aberystwyth on the shores of Cardigan Bay.

results.title: The Heart is highland
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Some aspects of the life of the people of the Scottish Highlands are shown, linking present developments in industry, agriculture and transport with the country’s dramatic past - well symbolised by the interior of Glamis Castle.

results.title: The Heart and circulatory system
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Media-Four Productions
results.brief_description: Establishes the function of the circulatory system in transporting oxygen and the history of ideas about this. Harvey’s early experiments are shown and also microphotography of the heart. Developments in current heart research are shown.

results.title: The Hearing Process
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs and Public Service Board of Victoria
results.brief_description: The Hearing Process is a function of the Victorian Public Service Board. It is freely available to all present and former officers and employees of the Public Service. This process is designed to protect the rights of all Public Service Officers and employees, and to enable staff to seek review of decisions which adversely affect them, other than decisions where another review or appeal body exists. The Victorian Public Service employes approximately 40,000 full and part time people. This video outlines the processes involved in presenting a case against unfair or inequitable treatment in the workplace.

results.title: The Health food movement
results.brief_description: The basic terms used by the health food movement are defined, and the activities of three typical health food advocates are used to explain details of the movement; an organic gardener, a manager of a health foods store, and a young family who eat mainly “natural foods”.

results.title: The Health connection
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Ferryman Productions and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at the operation of the NSW sewage system, in particular around the Sydney area. Shows the maintenance of the existing operation as well as the planning and construction of additional services to meet the increasing demands newly-settled areas. Stresses the quality control that is implemented to ensure that pollution levels remain below those that could endanger the health of the community.

results.title: The Healers of Aro
results.creator_credit: Ronald Fleher, Ben Park and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Describes an experiment in community mental health in Nigeria. Many people from countries engaged in rapid social changes cannot take the cross-cultural shock of development. For these people treatment combines western psychiatric techniques with ancient rituals, thereby not isolating them from society. Narrated by Ben Park.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald Fleher, Ben Park and United Nations Films
